page.title: 12Education
page.content: The district in the project is a rural one and as such does not offer a complete service within the area.Both Croft and Stoney Stanton have primary schools with community centres attached.These schools are modern having being built in the late 1960s and early 1970s.Children attend these primary schools from the ages of five to eleven.The children in Croft then attend a high school at Enderby and the children at Stoney Stanton attend a high school in Hinckley.At the age of 14 the Croft children then attend Lutterworth Grammar School while the Stoney Stanton children go on to the Hinckley community college.There is in the county a comprehensive system of education.Although there are still the old names ,the titles should not be taken at face value.
